result.execSummary:
The defendant Angela J Pinnow was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
--to pay restitution of $150 by July 15th, 2016; this restitution is payable to Daniel Leslie

Per Standing Order Defendant to pay 10% restitution surcharge
--to pay statutory costs, fees, assessments, plus $33 in subpoena fees
--to obtain/maintain employment and/or education program as approved by the Agent

--no possession or consumption of illegal drugs

--no possession of drug paraphernalia

--to maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol: no possession or consumption of alcohol

--no contact with Daniel Leslie unless both Mr. Leslie and the Agent agree 

--not to be present in any bar, tavern, liquor store

--to undergo any other assessment, treatment,  and counseling as deemed appropriate by the Agent

--to comply with DNA sample provision upon demand

Arresting Agency: JCSD

If probation, parole or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of the victim(s) and government entities for the balance due.
--to undergo AODA assessment within 90 days, and to follow through with recommended treatment; if an AODA assessment was recently done, Ms. Pinnow can provide this to the Agent as a substitute.

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt:
[MK] case called at 9:10am. 
Defendant Angela J Pinnow in court with Attorney Elizabeth F Svehlek.  DA Susan Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; plea of " No Contest " entered on Count #1; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified (DA Happ files the victim impact statement and restitution request form); the Court accepts the plea, finds Ms. Pinnow guilty of Count #1, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Count # 2.

On Count # 1, the Court withholds sentence, and places Ms. Pinnow on Probation for 4 years, with conditions:
--no possession or consumption of illegal drugs
--no possession of drug paraphernalia
--to maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol: no possession or consumption of alcohol
--to undergo AODA assessment within 90 days, and to follow through with recommended treatment;  if an AODA assessment was recently done, Ms. Pinnow can provide this to the Agent as a substitute. 
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment,  and counseling as deemed appropriate by the Agent
--no contact with Daniel Leslie unless both Mr. Leslie and the Agent agree 
--to pay restitution of $150 by July 15th, 2016; this restitution is payable to Daniel Leslie
--not to be present in any bar, tavern, liquor store
--to obtain/maintain employment and/or education program as approved by the Agent
--to comply with DNA sample provision upon demand
--to pay statutory costs, fees, assessments, plus $33 in subpoena fees


Days credit for time already served: 9  days
Felony firearm prohibition warnings given
recess 9:43am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 9, 2016 at 09:00 am.

[Scheduled for FSSC]

records.addlTxt:
Case called at 8:34am [mo]
Defendant Angela J Pinnow in court, in custody with Attorney Elizabeth F Svehlek.   ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Hall verifies victim rights compliance.

Ms. Pinnow waives her right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds her over for Trial.

ADA Hall submits the Information
Atty. Svehlek requests an Arraignment to be scheduled. 
The Court and Counsel discuss scheduling. 
recess:8:37am

NEXT:   Arraignment on 1/4/16 at 8:30am

Case called at 1:40pm [mo]
[Judge Randy Koschnick presiding for Branch II Intake]
[Hearing on Failure to Appear]
Defendant Angela J Pinnow appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, with Attorney Whitney Hagemann.  Public Service Special Prosecutor, Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin.  

Atty. Hagemann indicates that Ms. Pinnow is eligible for SPD representation and is currently represented by Atty. Svehlek.
On agreement of counsel, the Court finds that the videoconferencing system is sight and sound sufficient. 

The Court reviews the Court Record.
Atty. Hagemann gives explanation for Ms. Pinnow's missed court appearance.
Bond Arguments given by Counsel

The Court requires a $500 CASH bond, with the same special conditions as previously ordered. 
recess 1:48  pm. 


NEXT: JA to schedule Status Conference ASAP

Case called at 9:12am [mo]
Defendant Angela J Pinnow does NOT appear in court.
Attorney Elizabeth F. Svehlek appears in court.   ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Shock verifies victim rights compliance

The Court reviews the Court Record
Atty. Svehlek indicates that she has attempted to contact Ms. Pinnow today; had contact with her last week. 

Upon request of the State, the Court issues a bench warrant, body only.
The Court finds the bond in default and orders that the bond be forfeit. 
recess: 9:16am
original bond document received from JESO on 9/29/15

Court finds the proceedings are sight and sound sufficient
Atty Svehlek informs the Court that Miss Pinnow is eligible for SPD Services

Service of Complaint admitted; reading waived; maximum penalties recited
Preliminary Hearing time limits waived upon agreement of parties 

Court requires a $5000 signature bond, with conditions:

-No contact with Daniel Leslie
-No presence at Daniel Leslie's residence
Recess: 1:54 pm
